Reviews.Title: I made a great choice.
Reviews.Author: Willie D Edwards
Reviews.Content: Granted, this DVR comes with a sizable learning curve attached. Since i'm heavy into computers and the like, this wasn't terribly hard to get the hang of, but I can imagine someone like my mom or dad who just wants a minor surveillance system installed in their homes. This DVR is great, but can baffle a novice. IF you still want to try it out, be ready to do a bit of trial and error. Even I had to deal with some trial and error. And for the money, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: ZModo ZMD-DD-SAN8-1TB, Good, moderately priced system, does have a learning curve
Reviews.Author: J. Christie
Reviews.Content: I received this a few days ago and it did take some research and trial and error to set it up correctly.  Setting up the cameras to the DVR is easy and took about five minutes.  Viewing the cameras with an iPhone (internally and externally) and through Internet Explorer over the web took a little perseverance, but I did get it to work.  If you don't know networking or computers, you will have trouble setting up the iPhone and viewing over the web, but you will still be able to record and view video through the DVR itself.  Use ZViewer for the iPhone (not sure about Android) and note you need to set up two separate devices inside the app: one for inside your network and one for outside.  I don't think many people realize that the IP settings will be different for internal and external viewing (though the gateway, port, username and other settings will be the same).  I have a Linksys Router with a cable modem.  I did not need my ISP to do anything or call ZModo for tech support, and I did not make any changes to my cable modem.  You will need to set up port forwarding in your router to view over the web.  The documentation is out there on the web (see ZModo's knowledge base), you just have to find the docs and be willing to stay with it.  Also, with the Web Client for EDVS/EDVR software (Internet Explorer through the Web) I have been able to save AVI files for viewing with Windows Media Player. I have not tried it with the USB port through the DVR itself yet, however.I gave this 4 stars because I feel like these systems, while they work fine at what they do, are not for the average user even though they are advertised as such.  They take some know how to set up and if you can't set it up and get it working, it's pretty much useless to you.  Feel free to post questions and I will see if I can help.  I would buy this again, since I know what I am doing.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Jackson "Saxon"
Reviews.Content: I have had this unit for about one week so I cannot attest to the units longevity which I have seen some complaints about. However, I am very satisfied with this units functionality and versatility.Setup is easy. I am not a computer wiz by any means but I can figure out my way around a keyboard ;) (google, youtube and zmodo forums help a lot) If you are not concerned about plugging it in to a network this thing is literally plug and play out of the box within minutes.as far as network compatibility before doing anything make sure that your firewall is not blocking you from accessing your DVR I had to fully uninstall my aftermarket firewalls windows firewall is fine just allow access.Network setup takes a little bit longer but there is a zmodo website that will help you set up your router every step of the way . the zmodo website has you pick the router that you have and the main menu type that is on your zmodo and walks you through everything including making sure your ports are open in some cases one must call their internet provider to ensure they can open ports.  The only issue I had was that the ports the setup asked me to use were already taken so I used different ones. Once this is finished you will be able to access your footage on a device (once software is downloaded on device ie Zviewer for the phone and NVMS for windows [i have windows 8 which NVMS did not work for but you can open it under "Windows XP (service pack 2)" found within properties] I found NVMS on the zmodo website under the dvr model page)Remote setup was a little bit more difficult there is a separate IP for this (also you must know your Command port number for NVMS in network under DVR settings) in order to set it up on a phone or computer for remote viewing.Do a little research, have fun with it. The product works, no matter which one you decide to buy you will have to deal with the network issues. This is a good unit especially for the price. It does everything you might want it to.

Reviews.Title: ZMODO 8 DVR *WARNING! MS Security Essentials reports the software that came with this has a WIN/32 Sality.AM VIRUS!
Reviews.Author: AEinstein
Reviews.Content: I have not fully tested this DVR but am only posting the warning - I would not load the EXE files that come on the DVD.UPDATE:  This Security DVR appears to have some significant problems.  Nothing seems to work like it says.  Some things like connecting or viewing recordings seem to work sometimes and not others.PROS: Inexpensive.  Video display is good. Video brightness and contrast can be adjusted.CONS: There are many setup options which the average user will not understand.  There are others which are not explained in the user manual as to what they do or why.The PLAYBACK over the LAN cannot be viewed in FULL SCREEN mode.It is difficult to pick an EVENT in PLAYBACK.Changing SETTINGS over the LAN has problems as sometimes you can and sometimes you can't change a setting.I could not set the MOTION DETECT settings to work correctly.The recordings will place a TIME/DATE int the upper left of the screen and there seems to be no option to MOVE it in case it covers an important area.  You can turn it OFF but then the playback will not sow TIME/DATE.There are too many more things to list in the CON.I would not recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Works fine but network setup is a challenge
Reviews.Author: R. Ordowich
Reviews.Content: I installed the cameras and a monitor, powered up the unit and it worked fine.However setting up the network was not easy. After setting up the IP address and configuring my router for port forwarding there was no response. I could ping the DVR but could not access it via the LAN.What seemed to work was once I set up the network configuration, I did a "Save and Exit" and then I powered the DVR off completely and restarted it. I also restarted my router. It appears the settings did not take effect until I completely powered off and restarted both devices.When accessing the DVR over the LAN I also realized the login user name Admin is case sensitive. Remember to capitalize the "A". The web client appeared but no video. Down in the bottom left is a selection for "Open All" which displays all your cameras.To get my IPHONE to work I down loaded the app: Aplayer, set up the my WAN IP address and port 5050 used the Admin login with the password I set and it worked. You have to select which cameras you want to view by torching the buttons in the app.Playback of Motion recorded events sometimes crashes the browser (Internet Explorer 11).

Reviews.Title: Pretty good.
Reviews.Author: Joe Rigby "Joe T. Rigby"
Reviews.Content: I think what you get for the price is a pretty good deal. To clarify, you do not have to have an internet connection to use this product if you don't want to access the DVR over wifi or 4G. You do need a monitor with a VGA cable to set this thing up (not sure if it works with RCA cables...)I don't think this is for the novice computer user. I have a strong background in computers, and it took me about an hour to iron out all the issues. It does have a few quirks that need to be anticipated to work correctly.There are some apps out there for accessing the camera feeds with advertisements, _make sure you download the FREE app called Zviewer_ instead of an app that wants you to pay to get rid of ads - Exact same functionality with no ads!The issue I had was that I tried to connect with a PC browser, and I tried to connect with the smartphone and neither would work (both on LAN and on 4G).The error on the phone would say "Invalid Channel Number" and the web based client wouldn't even go past the login screen.Under network settings, the setting called "IP ACCESS" must be set to "Disable" ... just a little counter-intuitive.The other issue is that it requires the "A" in "Admin" (the username) to be capitalized when logging in - otherwise you get the invalid channel number error.The only other issue was that when it arrived, it was scuffed up all over the top, but it seems to work fine so no worries.As others have said, it will take some trial and error to get it to function properly, but I feel like it is a decent product given the price point.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo 8 Channel Security CCTV Surveillance DVR
Reviews.Author: 57_panhead
Reviews.Content: Very hard to set up, does not allow download files in AVI, MPG or any other media file. Need VCL Converter/player to look at the footage. All .264 files so if you didn't see it happen, expect to go through hours of footage conversion and playing. Wouldn't take my MAC address or allow port forwarding even with the network provider on the phone so no email alerts, it's sitting in its box and I updated to Swann which installed and I had remote view on all phones in 10 minutes w/ motion on any camera i want not on all. i would return it but I think I am beyond that point of time. Also all backups are .264 files so everything except what you see live and record or screenshot you are screwed. Missed a home invasion 5 days after install due to file formats and recording time was in GB not MB so if you were looking for a specific time, good luck.For sale $177 free shipping.

Reviews.Title: bad software interface
Reviews.Author: S. Campisi
Reviews.Content: remote access with this was an absolute nightmare.  i setup remote access for a living with all kinds of devices and this one's interface was completely non-intuitive and, in my experience, non-functional.  i installed the included software on three different pc's and none of them were ever able to view the cameras.  The built-in web-interface, accessed via the devices local ip address, required an ActiveX control that necessitated a number of modifications to the security settings of Internet Explorer (wouldn't work with Chrome) and it still would not log in with the default user or any admins i created.  The device itself looks nice and seems to record and playback just fine, but viewing it from another device is NOT a strong point for this device.

Reviews.Title: Set-up so easy, Even I could do it!
Reviews.Author: T.
Reviews.Content: We had a computer/surveillance company set us up with their more expensive DVR which kept breaking because of these imaginary "power surges" which mysteriously affected only the DVR. So this guy tells us it's gonna be $400 to replace the DVR with a new one. Off to Amazon I went in search of a less expensive highly-rated replacement and I found the Zmodo. The only thing I was worried about was completing the set-up, since I read a few reviews complaining how difficult it was. I was also reluctant to cut ties with our rip-off computer/surveillance company guy, figuring there was no way I could figure it out on my own (as he had told me). Boy, was he ever wrong! The only "glitch" I had in the set-up involved my Verizon router. I needed to call the manufacturer of the router to complete the set-up process. Start to finish it was 2 hours (and I know NOTHING about all this networking stuff). The DVR has been working like a charm for the past two months, and I swear the picture is even clearer than my old DVR. I use the Zmodo Zviewer app for my iPhone, and that set-up was a breeze!The only negative I have is the Zviewer app cannot access your DVR for playback...I does Live viewing just fine, but I wish you could playback events from your iPad or iPhone, kinda annoying to have to use the computer for playback.Overall, if you want to cut your computer/surveillance guy loose, this DVR is a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Poor documentation and Support...
Reviews.Author: falconer
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our old unit to this one for the mobile viewing and e-mail alert ability.Mobile viewing: After a week of struggling with what ports to open/fwd and finding the right viewing software, I got it working on our droid devices. FYI, the ports you need to open according to their website and included documentation are not correct. Nor I was able to get it working with their software. I got it working using IP Cam Viewer Lite software.Email notification: The implementation of this ability is terrible.  You can't set what time period you want to received the notifications. It is either on or off. So during the day while the store is open we constantly receive email notifications that motion has been detected, which is overwhelming and expensive if you are on a limited data plan. Also you can't set any kind of delay in how often the alerts are sent, so we received an email every 20 secs telling us motion had been detected.Ideally we would like to only receive the alerts during the hours the store is closed and an e-mail alert every 3mins would be more practical then every 20 secs.Unfortunately it took to long setup this device and get confirmation (a week) from the manufacture that in fact there is no settings or controls for email notification that we can no longer return the device.If someone knows of a DVR that will let you control the email notification I would appreciate a msg.
